data.title: Path2D editor bug fix and improvement
data.body:
- Fix #244 no path2d handles visible
- Update hotkey to be consistent with CollisionPolygon editor
- Add view-base point snap support (independent from node transform)

![](http://oi61.tinypic.com/2b713c.jpg)
Original curve

![](http://oi59.tinypic.com/xpzuia.jpg)
Use normal snapping, point is snapped to next step position

![](http://oi62.tinypic.com/28lz09w.jpg)
Activate view-base snapping, point is snapped to next grid point on view

data.title: Split font atlas texture into 1024*1024 size if atlas size > 1024
data.body:
Resize memory-pool chunk-size in editor/app
Split font atlas texture into 1024*1024 size if atlas size > 1024

data.title: no Path2D handles visible
data.body:
Hi,
the Path2D node has no handles that are visible. It is possible to create new segementes for pathes with ctrl+click but there is no point that is displayed for each created segementpoint. It is nearly impossible to edit a Path2D properly.
The usual Path in 3D has those handles which makes it very nice to edit.

data.title: Fix #240 TouchScreenButton release signal is not valid
data.body: The signal was misspelled as "release" (should be "released")

data.title: Add missing Matrix3::get_scale() binding
Add Viewport Hotkeys / Toggle maximize viewport
data.body:
- Alt-1..4 to switch 1~4 viewports
- Space to toggle maximizing  focused viewport

data.title: the signal of "release" of "TouchScreenButton" not valid
data.body:
1. add "TouchScreenButton" node
2. connect signal "release" for "TouchScreenButton" to a func
3. then click and release TouchScreenButton. the func can not got the release signal.

data.title: Add anchor options "Center"
data.body: Add Control anchor options "Center"

data.title: string length can not more than 15k
data.body:
var s = ""
loop:
    s += temp_str  
temp_str's length more than 15360 then print s,you can not get full string,and then you can get a string from s[0] to s[15360-1]

e.g. when I want to push a JSON file(the size more than 500K) from server to client(code by godot),the client can not get full file.

data.title: Maya and modo style navigation
data.body: - User can switch to maya/modo style 3d viewport navigation schema in editor setting.

data.title: Lift Godot GLView update frequency from 30 to 60
data.body:
30 fps is not smooth enough for some games, lift the default fps to 60;
With pull request #212, user can customize max fps per project by setting target_fps.

data.title: iOS "unable to iterate on type of nil"
data.body:
I've got some weird behavior I've been trying to track down unsuccessfully. I made a build of my project for iPhone and I've got a button that fires off a "for X in range(10)" loop. However when I press the button on iPhone, it gives me this error:

[1;31;40mERROR: InitBoard: [1;37;40mUnable to iterate on object of type Nil'.
[0;31;40m At: res://gamescreen.gdc:36.[0;0;37m

That line says: "   for Jter in range(10):"

Jter is defined earlier in the beginning of the file like so:

var Jter = 1

I had a function that did a lot of stuff but I pared it down to only this:

```
func InitBoard():
     for Jter in range(10):
          pass
     pass
```

and it's still giving me this error. 

Not quite sure what's going on. It only does this on iPhone, and when I run it from the editor or build a windows project it does work correctly.

The Initboard function is being called from another callback function within the control's script like so:

```
func _on_setupbutton_pressed():
   InitBoard()
   pass # replace with function body
```

I am not sure where or what causes it, I can send someone my project if requested.  As a test I did make an empty project with 2 nested for loops and it doesn't seem to have this problem.

data.title: "add_child(node)" doesn't work inside "_ready()" function
data.body:
Let's suppose I want to dinamically create a node 'newNode' from within a script, when some node N enters the scene... So, I should add the relevant code inside the "_ready()" function of the node N script. Something like:

from inside the script attached to the node N:

```
_ready():
   ...
   var newNode = preload("res://subScene.scn").instance()
   get_node("/root").get_child(0).add_child(newNode)
   ...
```

But this will not work: newNode will not be added to the scene. Instead, it will work if you call the add_child(node) from within another function of the script attached to the node N.

For now, a workaround is to use a "call_deferred" inside the _ready() function, so that the above code should be like that:

```
_ready():
   ...
   var newNode = preload("res://subScene.scn").instance()
   get_node("/root").get_child(0).call_deferred("add_child", newNode)
   ...
```

data.title: Fix Variant vector2/vecotor3 multiply bug
data.body:
Fix a bug amigamagic posted in IRC:

```
10 * Vector2(1, 2) returns Vector2(0, 0), should return Vector2(10, 20)
```

Ignore auto-generated doc_data_compressed.h
Add display/resizable to project setting to prevent windwo from resizing
data.body: Fix Issue #172: Need option to lock a specific window size

data.title: Funtion variables like vec1, vec2 throws parsing related error
data.body:
Hi

I was trying to write some functions in a class library that was instanced via preloading

ie
mylib=preload("res://mylib/lib.dg")

boolean=mylib.myfunction(Pos,vec)

And the function in the lib was something like

func myfunction(vec1,vec2):
 if vec1.x==vec2.x:
   return true

Now the function above kept giving me parsing, or expecting some identifier type error. After hitting my head against walls, I decided to just change to a and b. Then Godot stopped complaining and started working properly (ie preloaded the func form lib and executed properly)

I have resolved the issue so I do not remember the exact error message but it was about gdscript.cpp line some 14xx I believe. Sorry Iw as trying to get it going so i did not keep record. However it might be worth checking.

I do not think that numerals normally was  problem for variables that way..

thanks

data.title: High DPI Support
data.body:
I'd like to look into supporting High DPI displays, in particular "Retina" on OS X.

Does anyone at Okam have access to the original artwork for the default UI theme? It would assist with creating higher resolution assets.

data.title: Bug when compiling on Windows with MinGW
data.body: It works fine for a debug build, but when I make a release build, executable fails with a null pointer error. I'm using MinGW 4.8.0.

data.title: Error when running on windows XP
data.body:
I may compile for Windows XP using MS Compiler 2013 using command line like this:

call "%ProgramFiles(x86)%\Microsoft Visual Studio 12.0\VC\bin\vcvars32.bat"

::setup paths
set INCLUDE=%ProgramFiles(x86)%\Microsoft SDKs\Windows\7.1A\Include;%INCLUDE%
set PATH=%ProgramFiles(x86)%\Microsoft SDKs\Windows\7.1A\Bin;%PATH%
set LIB=%ProgramFiles(x86)%\Microsoft SDKs\Windows\7.1A\Lib;%LIB%

::cl and linker settings
set CL=/D_USING_V110_SDK71_ %CL%
set LINK=/SUBSYSTEM:CONSOLE,5.01 %LINK%

scons

On XP it fails with null pointer error (no matter whether its debug o release build), but it works fine on Windows 7

data.title: RayCast2D exclude objects
data.body:
It would be great to have an api extension for excluding RayCast collisions from certain objects! Take a look at the thread below for further information!

http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=337&p=1454#p1454

Also a thought! At the moment it is only possible to get one collider object at a time. What if the ray hits more than one object. Which object is prefered? First hitobject?
It would be nice to have somehow a list of the collider_objects. This way one can loop through all hitobjects and do stuff with them.

data.title: Implement thread id in windows platform
data.body: Implement thread id in windows platform

data.title: GDscript: The real(...) built-in function does not exist
data.body:
According to the docs within the editor, in order to convert an int (or a String) to a floating-point number, I should use the function real(value), just as I would use str(...) or int(...). However, Godot fails to run that function, and complains that there is no such function in my class (or the class I am extending).

It seems, however, that the function float(...) does exactly what real(...) is expected to do. Therefore, it is either a bug in the script interpreter that real(...) does not exist, or it is a bug in the docs.

data.title: Strange behaviour when preloading script files without "res://" prefix...
data.body:
Let's suppose I have a scene file for a bullet in my game. When in the main scene file I create this bullet, I do something like that:

```
var bulletClass = preload("bullet.gd")
var bulletScene = preload("bulletScene.xml")
# note: bulletScene main node is a RigidBody2D node 
#       with the "bullet.gd" script attached to it

myBullet = bulletScene.instance()
```

Now, if I want to check if my sprite collided with a bullet, I would do something like:

```
func _integrate_forces(s):
    ...
    var numContacts = s.get_contact_count()
    for i in range(numContacts):
        colObject = s.get_contact_collider_object(i)
        if (colObject extends bulletClass):
            ...hey, we collided with a bullet, so let's do something...
        else:
            ...we collided with something else...
    ...
```

But... in the above situation "colObject extends bulletClass" returns always false, so I cannot check if the object collided with a bullet or not.

Now, the strange thing is that if you preload gdscript resources with the "res://" prefix, the above code will work!

For example, if in the above initialization code I write:

```
var bulletClass = preload("res://bullet.gd")
```

then, the "colObject extends bulletClass" expression works as expected! Instead, it doesn't work without the "res://" prefix... Why?

data.title: x11 WM_CLASS not set on Godot windows on Linux....
data.body:
WM_CLASS is not set on Godot windows on Linux.

Try the following in the terminal:

xprop WM_CLASS

And then click a Godot window, and it returns nothing. Try any other Window, to see what kind of data it should return.

I am getting a bizarre error. This happened suddenly not sure what is going on. Everything was fine. Saved my work and try to reopen my scene.

I am under Debian64 Intel . I have 32gb ram I doubt that I can run out of memory
